com.xtructure.xneat.network
Interface NeuralNetwork

All Known Implementing Classes:
NeuralNetworkImpl
public interface NeuralNetwork

The NeuralNetwork interface describes the methods used to run a neural network.

Author:
Luis Guimbarda

Method Summary
 void clearSignals()
          Sets the energies of neurons in the network to 0.0.
 double[] getOutputSignals()
          Gets the energies of the the outputs in the NeuralNetwork.
 boolean relaxNetwork(int maxSteps, double maxDelta)
          Propagates the energies through the network until the network reaches equilibrium or for the given number of steps.
 void setInputSignals(double[] inputSignals)
          Sets the energies to use as inputs in the NeuralNetwork.
 double singleStep()
          Propagates the energies through the network for one step.
 

Method Detail

setInputSignals

void setInputSignals(double[] inputSignals)
Sets the energies to use as inputs in the NeuralNetwork.

Parameters:
inputSignals - the new input signals

getOutputSignals

double[] getOutputSignals()
Gets the energies of the the outputs in the NeuralNetwork.

Returns:
the energies of the the outputs in the NeuralNetwork.

singleStep

double singleStep()
Propagates the energies through the network for one step. (A single step allows each neuron processes its input energies once.)

Returns:
the max signal delta

relaxNetwork

boolean relaxNetwork(int maxSteps,
                     double maxDelta)
Propagates the energies through the network until the network reaches equilibrium or for the given number of steps. (Equilibrium is reached when the total change in energy with the network is less then the given maxDelta. A single step allows each neuron processes its input energies once.) The returned boolean indicates whether the network reached equilibrium before the maxSteps.

Parameters:
maxSteps - the max steps
maxDelta - the max delta
Returns:
true if the network reach equilibrium within maxSteps, false otherwise.

clearSignals

void clearSignals()
Sets the energies of neurons in the network to 0.0.
